info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:41AM MST until January 18 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and wind expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 50 MPH. * WHERE...The Southern Hills, Albion Mountains, Raft River Region, Marsh and Arbon Highlands, Franklin and Eastern Oneida Region, and Bear Lake Valley, including but not limited to Albion, Malta, Rockland, Holbrook, Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, Preston, Montpelier, Georgetown, Sweetzer Summit, Holbrook Summit, Malad Pass, Fish Creek Summit, Georgetown Summit, Geneva Summit, and Border Summit. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 2 PM Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained at 511.idaho.gov.
